intro: Caraipa davilae, commonly known as the Davilae caraipa, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and requires well-drained soil and full sun. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
